text: my mother used to always tell me that
regardless of how much you might despise
someone once you get to know them you
will always find something about them
that you like and I found that a very
good observation and the same thing
applied to fwell the Reverend fwell
spoke out against me for 15 years on his
oldtime gospel hour and then we did a
satire on him in the magazine which was
rather unflattering and he didn't like
that so he sued me and we fought for
another four years in court and it
became our Landmark Supreme Court
decision we were bitter
enemies then I had an opportunity to
meet with him the trials were all over
and I figured you know why not I think
he was
misguided I think he was wrong about
many things and there was really nothing
that I agreed with him about some of the
things were just so bizarre and so for
out like he held a press conference one
day to say that the Teletubbies were gay
because they weree purple clothes or
something I called him up and I said
Reverend I said you're one of the best
known evangelists in the world and I
said how could you do something so
stupid this can't help you he said you
know what I been thinking about that I
was wrong I shouldn't have done that
that's how Farwell was it wasn't that he
was necessarily mean-spirited but he
said and did a lot of things that came
off that
[Music]
way
